A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is an oddly-shaped Star Wars movie that largely squanders the cast of the original trilogy\, and the potential of several of its newer characters. A needless subplot\, overlong coda\, and some ill-judged comedy take up too much of its running time\, and Benicio Del Toro and Laura Dern look like they've wandered in from a different movie. There are plus points\, including the intriguing relationship between Kylo Ren and Rey\, a touching reunion between Luke and Leia\, and a calamitous mid-space collision\, but these moments are not enough to keep Episode VIII from being a disappointment.
